facts.fact: High-fiber diets lower bad cholesterol naturally.
facts.tip: Include oats, beans, and fruits daily to improve heart health.

facts.fact: Regular exercise reduces heart disease risk by 30%.
facts.tip: Aim for at least 30 minutes of walking, 5 days a week.

facts.fact: Smoking doubles your risk of heart attack.
facts.tip: Quit smoking and avoid secondhand smoke to protect your heart.

facts.fact: Excessive stress increases blood pressure and heart strain.
facts.tip: Practice meditation, yoga, or deep breathing to keep stress levels low.

facts.fact: Too much salt can lead to high blood pressure.
facts.tip: Limit processed foods and use herbs/spices instead of salt in cooking.

facts.fact: Getting less than 6 hours of sleep regularly raises heart risk.
facts.tip: Maintain a sleep routine and aim for 7–8 hours of quality rest.

facts.fact: Obesity is a major risk factor for heart disease.
facts.tip: Maintain a healthy weight with balanced nutrition and regular activity.

facts.fact: Excess sugar intake can increase the risk of heart problems.
facts.tip: Cut down on sugary drinks and snacks; opt for natural sweeteners in moderation.

facts.fact: Omega-3 fatty acids improve heart health and reduce inflammation.
facts.tip: Include fatty fish like salmon, flaxseeds, and walnuts in your diet.

facts.fact: Hydration supports proper blood flow and heart function.
facts.tip: Drink at least 7–8 glasses of water daily and avoid excessive caffeine.
